text:
(a) What are "Reports" in a database system?
(b) List four (4) ways in which Reports can be viewed in database management system.
(c) Outline the steps to prints a Report in MS Access.
correct_answer:
(a)A report is a database object that is caused to present information in database for the purpose of displaying or distributing a summary of data. OR Reports offer a way to extract and present a specific subset of information from a large database. OR Reports allow the user to organize and present your data in a reader-friendly manner, visually appealing format. OR Reports present data from tables and also from queries. OR A database report is the formatted result of database queries and contains useful data for decision-making and analysis.
(b)Reports can be viewed through;
(i) Design view (ii) Report view (iii) Layout (iv) Print preview
(c)Steps to print a Report;
- Right-click on the report name on the navigation pane - click print preview - click print/CTRL + P - click OK
OR
- Select the report on the navigation pane and click - click Print preview - click Print/CTRL + P - click OK

(b) Give one use of the following computer graphics application tools;
(i) Interactive Fill Tool (ii) Texture Fill Tool (iii) Envelops Tool (iv) Extrude Tool 
(c) Name one Fill Tool in computer graphic application which is needed to (i) create a background that is faded from light blue to white (ii) fill an object with two colours that blend from one to another.
correct_answer:
(a) Computer graphics;
(i) Computer graphicsare pictures and images/films created using computers. It refers to computer generated image data created with help from specialized graphical hardware and software.ORComputer Graphics is the creation of pictures/ímages/films with the help of a computerORComputer graphics is the creation, manipulation and storage of geometric objects (modeling) and their images (rendering)ORComputer graphics is an art of drawing pictures, lines, charts and other graphical images with the help of installed specialized programs on a computer/applications on a computer.ORComputer graphics are made up of number of pixels which are the smallest graphical picture or unit represented on the computer screen.ORComputer graphics refer to the representation and manipulation of image data by a computer screen.ORComputer graphics is the various technologies used to create and manipulate images in form of pixel drawn on the computer/methods for digitally synthesizing and manipulating visual content,
(ii)Specific application areas of graphics in advertising;(1) Animation/Motion pictures (2) Business card (3) Branding (4) Billboards (5) Flex creation (6) Posters (7) Modelling/Design (8) Digital marketing (9) Pitching for project (10) Print media ads (11) Tv commercials (12) Banner (13) Logo design (14) Letter-head (15) Presentation (16) Postcards (17) Info graphics (18) Brochure (19) Vehicle wraps (20) Signature and trade show display (21) Email marketing templates

(i) Interactive filltool is used to create a fill dynamically by using markers in the drawing window and property bar to change the angle, midpoint and colour of an object/image.ORInteractive fill tool allows you to add the same fills to objects as the normal fill tool, but in an interactive way by setting the interactive properties. This is especially useful for fountain fills.ORInteractive fill tool is used to apply two colour effect on items.ORInteractive fill tool is used to apply fountain fills (gradients)
(ii) Texture fillis used to apply preset texture fills to objects in order to create the illusion of variety of textures such as water, clouds and stone.ORTexture fill is used to give an object natural appearanceORTexture fill is used to apply fractal fill.

text: Write a QBASIC program to grade any score entered from the keyboard as either "Poor" for a score that is below 50% or "Satisfactory" for a score that is equal to or above 50%. The program execution should stop as soon as a score that is less than zero is entered.
correct_answer:
Qbasic Program to grade entered scores
10 REM program to grade entered scores20 CLS30 Score = 040 DO UNTIL score < 050 INPUT "Enter a score:"; Score60 IF Score <50 THEN70 PRINT "Poor"80 ELSE90 PRINT "Satisfactory"100 END IF110 LOOP120 ENDOR
REM PROGRAM TO GRADE ENTERED SCORESREM USING SELECT CASE...END STRUCTURECLSDIM   SCORE AS INTEGERDO UNTIL Score < 0INPUT "Enter a score:";ScoreSELECT CASE (SCORE)CASE 50 to 100PRINT "SATISFACTORY"CASE 1 TO 49PRINT "POOR"END SELECTLOOPENDOR
REM PROGRAM FOR "GRADING SYSTEM"CLSScore = 0DO UNTIL Score > = 0INPUT ScoreSELECT CASE (SCORE)IF Score > = 0 THENIF Score < 50 THENPRINT "poor"ELSEIF Score > = 50THEN PRINT "satisfactory"END IFEND IFLOOPENDOR
DIM     SCORE AS INTEGARSCORE = 0DO WHILE Score > = 0INPUT "Enter a score:"; ScoreSELECT CASE (Score)CASE 50 TO 100PRINT "SATISFACTORY"CASE 0 TO 49PRINT "POOR"END SELECTLOOPENDOR
REM PROGRAM FOR "GRADING SYSTEM"CLSScore = 0DO     while score > = 0INPUT ScoreIF Score > = 0 THENIF Score < 50 THENPRINT "poor"ELSEIF Score .> = 50 THENPRINT "satisfactory"END IFEND IFLOOPEND
